gc01.cw.robf.controller

Class MainViewController

  • java.lang.Object
    • gc01.cw.robf.controller.MainViewController

  • public class MainViewController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller for the main application interface. Includes click-able view of table layout and control over basic order information. Uses FXML template. Access to restricted menus (User and Menu editor) dependent on type of logged in user.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Rob Farthing

      MainViewController()

      • MainViewController

        public MainViewController()

    • Method Detail

      • logout

        public void logout(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Method triggered when user presses Logout button. Closes the Main view and reloads the Login view.
        Parameters:
        event - Event object passed during trigger.

      • manageUsers

        public void manageUsers(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Method triggered when user presses Manage Users button. Loads the Manage Users view in modal and undecorated mode to force user to complete interaction with Manage Users view before returning to Main view. Applies overlay CSS formatting to window as well as basic formatting. This button is only available if the user is of type Manager.
        Parameters:
        event - Event object passed during trigger.

      • manageOrders

        public void manageOrders(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Method triggered when user presses Manage Orders button. Loads the Manage Orders view in modal and undecorated mode to force user to complete interaction with Manage Orders view before returning to Main view. Applies overlay CSS formatting to window as well as basic formatting. Overrides EventHandler for when Orders view is closed so that the table layout in Main view is cleared as it could have changed.
        Parameters:
        event - Event object passed during trigger.

      • manageMenuItems

        public void manageMenuItems(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Method triggered when user presses Manage Menu button. Loads the Manage Menu view in modal and undecorated mode to force user to complete interaction with Manage Menu view before returning to Main view. Applies overlay CSS formatting to window as well as basic formatting. This button is only available if the user is of type Manager.
        Parameters:
        event - Event object passed during trigger.

      • clearTable

        public void clearTable(javafx.event.Event event)
        Method triggered when user presses Clear Table button. Resets the layout of the tables, clears the order pane and flushes the current order. Can be called at any time to reset the view.
        Parameters:
        event - Event object passed during trigger.

      • selectTable

        public void selectTable(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Method triggered when user clicks any table Shape defined in the Main FXML. Clears any existing selection and highlights clicked table. Sets the selected table number and displays any existing orders in the order pane.
        Parameters:
        event - Mouse event object passed during trigger.

      • openOrder

        public void openOrder(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Method triggered when user presses Open Order button. Open order button is only available if a table has been selected and there is no current Open order for that table. When triggered, creates a new order object on the highlighted table and immediately saves it to file. Refreshes the order pane.
        Parameters:
        event - Event object passed during trigger.

      • closeOrder

        public void closeOrder(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Method triggered when user presses Close Order button. Close order button is only available if a table has been selected and there is an Open order for that table. When triggered, activates an Alert prompt and if user accepts this, closes the order on the highlighted table and immediately saves to file. Clears the table selection as this order can no longer be modified.
        Parameters:
        event - Event object passed during trigger.

      • editOrderItems

        public void editOrderItems(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Method triggered when user presses Edit button under Order pane's Items list box. Button only available if a table has been selected and there is an Open order for that table. Loads the Edit Order Items view in modal and undecorated mode to force user to complete interaction before returning to Main view. Applies overlay CSS formatting to window as well as basic formatting. Overrides EventHandler for when view is closed to refresh Order pane as it could have changed.
        Parameters:
        event - Event object passed during trigger.

      • saveComments

        public void saveComments(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Method triggered when user presses Save button under comments text box. Save button is only available if a table has been selected and there is an Open order for that table. When triggered, sets the comments in the current Order and immediately saves to file.
        Parameters:
        event - Event object passed during trigger.

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Method automatically called by JavaFX Application class when loading a view. Loads existing list of orders and enables User and Menu Manager buttons if the currentUser type is MANAGER.
